removals.reasoning: The outer parentheses around the cast expression are redundant when used as a function argument; the cast (double*) is preserved.
Outer parentheses around the cast are unnecessary in the argument list; keep the cast but remove the redundant surrounding parentheses.
Same as above: redundant outer parentheses around a cast used as a call argument.
Same as above: the outer parentheses add no precedence or clarity and can be removed.
Redundant outer parentheses around a cast used as a call argument; keep the cast but remove the extra parentheses.
The outermost parentheses around the cast are redundant inside free(); the inner cast must remain.
Remove the redundant outer parentheses around the cast expression used as the free() argument.
Same as above: outermost parentheses are unnecessary; keep the necessary casts.

Parentheses around the variable operands are unnecessary ((double)(i) -> (double)i); the outer grouping around the division is redundant — this keeps a clear grouping for the multiply while removing redundant wrapping.
The outer parentheses around the sum are unnecessary for the assignment; also the index expression can be written without the extra parentheses.
Parentheses around the array index expression are redundant and removing them improves readability without changing semantics.
Outer parentheses around the division result are unnecessary; (double)(n) can be simplified to (double)n (the cast remains).
Remove redundant parentheses around the array index expression.
The outer parentheses around the subtraction are unnecessary in the assignment; simplifying makes the statement clearer.
Redundant parentheses around the array index add no value; remove them for readability.
Remove unnecessary parentheses around the index expression.
Parentheses around the indexing are redundant and can be removed safely.
Index parentheses are unnecessary; removing them makes the code more idiomatic C.

The extra inner parentheses around (num + factor) and around the subtraction are redundant; writing the numerator as num + factor - 1 is equivalent and clearer while preserving the grouping before division.
The outer parentheses are redundant. Keep the cast (uint8_t*) and drop unnecessary parentheses around the address expression for clarity.
Same rationale: remove redundant outer parentheses around the casted address.
Remove redundant outer parentheses around the casted address; leave the cast itself.
Outer parentheses around the cast+address are unnecessary and can be removed.
Drop redundant parentheses around the casted address argument to memcpy.
Outer parentheses add no value; keep the cast but remove the extra wrapping.
Remove redundant outer parentheses around the casted address.
The cast must remain but parentheses around the &grid are redundant in this context.
Remove outer parentheses around the casted address for clarity.
Redundant outer parentheses around casted address; safe to remove.
Outer parentheses are superfluous; the cast itself must remain.
Remove redundant parentheses around the cast+address expression.
Drop unnecessary outer parentheses around the cast to improve readability.
The parentheses around the cast+address are redundant; removing them simplifies the call.
Remove the extra parentheses around the casted address argument.
Outer parentheses around (uint8_t*)(&grid) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Outer parentheses around the cast are redundant; drop them and keep the cast.
Same as above: unnecessary outer parentheses around the casted address.
Remove redundant parentheses around the casted address argument to memcpy.
Outer parentheses are redundant; keep the cast but remove extra wrapping.
Parentheses around the subtraction expression are not required as a function argument; m - 1 is clear and unambiguous.
Same as above: the argument can be passed without surrounding parentheses.
Parentheses around an identifier used as a function argument are unnecessary.
Remove superfluous parentheses around the array index expression; this is the idiomatic form in C.
Unnecessary parentheses around the identifier passed to fprintf(); removing them improves readability.
